fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41939].
  {panel}

Case: Issue has one attachment. User selects "View in Jira" for the issue, and wants to remove the attachment and then add a new attachment.

At first attachments can be seen, and there is an option to add more attachments. But when the (last/only) attachment is deleted, the entire section "Attachments" disappears and the only way to add an attachment is to click the "Edit" button. 

Suggestion: Even if there are no attachments, keep the "Add attachment" feature available, without entering edit mode.

Please see attached screen shots.
fields.summary: Adding an attachment when no attachment exists

[Documentation link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA052/Created+vs+Resolved+Issues+Report].

In this page, the screen shot in "Generating a Created vs Resolved Issues report" has an image regarding the Created vs Resolved gadget options, instead of the report one. The gadget has a few more options, misleading customers that the report should have that, and no the other way around.

This is the documentation with the right screenshot: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA052/Adding+the+Created+vs+Resolved+Gadget

Cheers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41918].
  {panel}

Many Cloud instances have experienced problems with Incoming Email Servers/Handlers recently.

Some JIRA Cloud instances are having a problem where the following error message appears in Mail Handler, preventing issues/comments creation via email:
{noformat}
Summary:
1 message read from the server.
Found 1 unprocessed message(s) in the pop3s folder.
Potential mail loop detected. Message will be removed.
Deleting Message 'Re: Atlassian test'
{noformat}

There doesn't seem to be any reason for email loops, are the email used in Incoming Mail Servers are not the same for users or notifications.

It seems that the users having this problem had emails aliases. These seem to be the culprit.

*Workaround*
White list the domains used by the email address with this problem
* Go to the Incoming Mail page
* Find the 'Advanced Configuration' section
* In 'Whitelisted domains' add a comma-separated list of the domains used by the emails
* Click 'Save'.
fields.summary: Many JIRA Cloud instances are having problems with Incoming Mail Handlers recently
relative date user preference

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41914].
  {panel}

You can mouseover to get exact date.
However, 7 days works well for many organizations, others would prefer 2 days (so just limited to minutes ago/today/yesterday/tommorow), a few would prefer month.

Had a request to keep the handy minutes ago but get rid of the 6 days ago.
Can see where if someone reports a problem, they might pulling up a calendar to figure out which logfiles to look at, instead of easy mouseover, or what I would consider easy math like 4 FEB 15 minus 6d is 28 JAN 15 -  easily mistaken for 29 JAN 15.

Maybe we just *add the ability to show both pieces of information without mouseover. Display absolute date + relative date.* A mouseover is something you have to teach people of it's existance; vs a handy, international, sortable in exports:
*2015-02-04 13:09 (27 min ago)*
or
2015-02-02 13:09 (2 days ago, monday)

Related files for configurable cutoff value: AbstractDateTimeRelativeDatesFormatter DateTimeRelativeFormatter HtmlMetadataManager

Could be made into separate ticket but while on subject, instead of using jira-config.properties *allow jira.lf.date.relativize in the admin-ui* for easier toggling (jpm.xml requires-restart is false and it could be sysadmin-editable true). i.e. Not everyone has HA/datacenter, if you disable it in one maintenance window, and people demand it back now have to restart again.

This is for read views, for entering information like 'due in 5 days' see other tickets such as JRA-16366
fields.summary: configurable relative date cutoff (or date+relative without mouseover)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41912].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When configuring workflow steps, Long lists of statuses with no discernible sort order cause people to miss things and make mistakes.

h3. Suggested Solution
Can you have the linked Status values appear in alpha order as well as when you navigate to the Statuses screen, have them appear in alpha order?  

This would improve usability when working with long lists.
fields.summary: Status Order
Provide ability to reorder steps in the workflow designer
Ability to directly edit version from its' summary

Admin Audit Log should include profiling and logging events
Option to create Task in User story

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41889].
  {panel}

Hello Jira

We see a security issue that unauthorized attacks on Jira (using i.e. brute force attacks) could find out whether a username exists or not by checking if the captcha request would appear.

h3.Use case:

- When trying to log into Jira (or other Atlassian products) with an invalid username, the captcha request would never appear
- As soon as a valid username would be entered, the captcha request would show up after n (as configurable in Jira) tries.

This means, it would be possible to find out if a username exists or not.

h3.Suggestion:
Would it be possible to configure Jira to *ALWAYS* show a captcha when logging into to system? That would of course mean that a user would always need to enter the captcha, but an unautorized attack would not be able to determine existing usernames.

I would be excited to hear your opinion on that issue.

Thanks
Tom
fields.summary: Always show captchas on Jira login screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41884].

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41881].
  {panel}

In the older version of JIRA the default notification message is in one line as shown below:

Image get from JIRA version 6.4-OD-08-003 :
!older_version.PNG|thumbnail!

However in the latest version JIRA 6.4-OD-13-026 the default notification message is now in 2/3 lines.

If the notification is configured through *Project Administration* -> *HipChat Integration* as explained [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+with+HipChat#] without post function configured.
The default notification message will be in 2 lines:
!hipchat_projectintegrate.PNG|thumbnail!

If *Hipchat Notify* post function is added to the transition the default notification message will be in 3 lines:
!new_version.PNG|thumbnail!
!hipchat_postfunction.PNG|thumbnail!

Of course you can customize the notification message at the post function but it will be a hassle to configure for each of the transitions.
Therefore the customer would prefer to have the default notification message in one line so that the chat room will not be flood by the notification message.
fields.summary: Default HipChat Notification Messesage in One line

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41878].
  {panel}

JRA-24213 enables administrators to migrate users between Internal and Delegated Auth directories. However, this will migrate *all users*.

It would be great to have the ability to only migrate certain users or group of users. An example would be the following

In JIRA, my employees and also external contractors/customers are all stored in Internal Directory. I have an LDAP directory with only information of my employees. I would only like to migrate all employees to Delegated Auth, while keeping contractors/customers in Internal Directory because I don't have information of contractors/customers in my LDAP

At the moment, this is impossible to perform.
fields.summary: Migrate certain users or group of users between directories

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41873].
  {panel}

Aim: Add placeholder within comment for instance...
"Hi, why is this ticket not done / updated for more than X days?" 
We want to personalize this comments like

"HI $current_assignee, this ticket has not been updated since $last_updated_time please explain what's the reason."

So we need to use placeholders in the Comments that will be replace by JIRA.

"Hi Daniel Roß, this ticket has not been updated since 01. January 2014 please explain what's the reason."

This concept only works with the [text formatting notation|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all] of [~ username] where users are are still required to manually select from a list.
fields.summary: Add Identifier or Placeholder in Comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41872].
  {panel}

Below documentation outline that Changing the Project Key Format for Cloud instance is possible 

- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Changing+the+Project+Key+Format

But on Restricted Functions in Cloud Applications, Changing project key pattern is one of the Restricted Function. 
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Restricted+functions+in+JIRA+Cloud

Request to update the documents to avoid confusion.


{color:green}*Resolution*{color}
The doc stating that it was possible to change Project Key Format on Cloud was removed from our documentation base:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Changing+the+Project+Key+Format

Which means that, in fact, Atlassian choose to keep this functionality as a Restricted Function.
You can check it in the following doc by simply searching for *Changing project key pattern*:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Restricted+functions+in+JIRA+Cloud
fields.summary: Changing the Project Key Format for Cloud instance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41860].
  {panel}

1. Set up JIRA with default character limit set (advanced settings, it's set to '0' which is unlimited by default). Set the limit to some low value like 300.
2. Create a collector, for example "raise bug collector"
3. Set up a page with collector 
4. Enter more characters than the limit (in this example more than 300) and submit the collector.

Result:
Collector form is frozen until the ajax timeout occurs (currently it's 360 seconds). Under the hood, the server responds with a 500 right away but the response is ignored.

Expected result:
As soon as server responds with 500 the collector form displays error message to the user.
fields.summary: Issue collector frozen when description/environment of created Issue exceeds the character limit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41841].
  {panel}

originally copied from [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-3101?focusedCommentId=266720&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-266720] 

bq. Function linkedIssues() only shows the issues linked to a particular issue, I want to find all issues those are linked to other issues marked by a specific link type, e.g., "is blocked by".

This function could incorporate querying issues that are linked _to any issue_ with a given link type and bearing in mind that links have two identities, one in each direction, the link type could be direction specific or not. 

h4. Examples

# find all issues that are duplicates of issue JRA-25640 (one direction, issue specified)
# find all issues that are blocking issue JRA-25640 or that JRA-25640 blocks (bidirectional, issue specified)
# find all issues that are duplicates of any issue, or which duplicate any issue (bidirectional, no issue specified)
# find all issues that are blocked (one direction, no issue specified)

h4. Implementation Notes

* The JQL function that exists must continue to work exactly as it does. If it is possible to overload the JQL function based on arity and this makes a consistent API, then this would be preferred. Otherwise, there may need to be a new function name which provides vararg behaviour as described above.
* The link index entries added in 4.4 (I think) provide enough to build performant lucene queries for the above use cases. What's missing is the JQL function plumbing.
fields.summary: JQL function for showing all issues linked to any issue by a given issue link type

fields.description:
JIRA v6.3.8 is configured to create/comment issues from email.

We recognized that while sending emails with attachements in some cases the attachment does not show up in JIRA.
The Logs give us
{code}
2015-01-28 17:50:52,256 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-2 ERROR ServiceRunner    XXXX Task [mail.incoming.CreateOrCommentHandler.1] Exception while adding attachments to XXXX-3007. Some attachments from the message might be missing. Making a note on the issue.
{code}
*This is no inline Mail problem,*
*this is also no HTML/Rich Text formatting problem.*

The problem occurs reproduce able when a test mail is send multiple times in a short time frame, for example 4 times a minute.
We got success 3 times, 1 time fail.

The problems sporadicly occurs when a forwarded customer mail should be attached to a JIRA Task.
fields.summary: Function mail.incoming.CreateOrCommentHandler produces error "Exception while adding attachments to" when sending email with attachment 4 times a minute

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41838].
  {panel}

Currently the Agile Gadget used on dashboards must be manually configured by entering start/end dates for the range to display.

When you have many dashboards with 1 or more Agile Gadgets this introduces severe overhead to go through each one and update the dates.

In our cases, these dates are tied to Fix Versions, which have dates associated with them already.

Ideally we would be able to have a checkbox or option to "Use Current Fix Version" which would just use the same technique as EarliestUnreleasedVersion() to find the dates associated with the Project.

That way the dates would always automatically update and the Agile Gadget could be used hassle-free to track burndowns over the course of a Fix Version.
fields.summary: Allow the Agile Gadget to use the dates from Fix Versions or Sprints automatically
Edit JIRA-Hipchat Documentation to mention SSL Integration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41836].
  {panel}

With the recent updates, the _Time Sheet_ report (Excel format) includes the hyperlink in the Summary of the report (see attachment). For some users, it is not useful due to they use the content of the summary to create bills for their customers. As of now, they will need to remove it manually.

It would be great to either remove hyperlink from the title of the report or add the ability/feature to configure the excel format (e.g include or exclude the hyperlink) before generating it

*Steps to reproduce*:
- Go to _Projects -> your preferred project -> Overview -> Reports -> Time Sheet report -> Fill in the details -> Excel View_
fields.summary: Remove hyperlink in the Summary of Time Sheet Report

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

While creating a JIRA Report we add a property in atlassian-plugin.xml to render a select.
Unable to add an <optgroup> for the select.

<property>
          <key>versionId</key>
          <name>report.version.label</name>
          <type>select</type>
          <values class="com.test.reports.VersionValuesGenerator"/>
</property>
fields.summary: Adding <optgroup> for select field rendered in Jira Reports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41832].
  {panel}

Hello JIRA Product Management,

Perhaps there is already a report for this in Jira, however it would be great if the Versions tab within the Projects space could be enhanced to include more detailed information regarding the Version.  Specifically, we run into instances where other business teams require information about software versions that we release into production.  

People frequently want to know what issues (tickets) were in a Version (this info is already provided in the Versions tab), whether each ticket was a bug fix or a new feature, who worked on each ticket, and how much time they spent on each ticket.  It would be great if all this information would be readily available to download as a .csv or .xls as well so we could pass this information along to other business teams easily.

Thank you,

Andrew T
fields.summary: Enhance Reporting in Versions Tab

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41831].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Creating issues with one mail to 3 different addresses fails in JIRA 6.3 and 6.4
When we have 3 different mail handlers and each one of them associating with a different project:
* Mail Handler 1 --> Project 1
* Mail Handler 2 --> Project 2
* Mail Handler 3 --> Project 3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 3 projects
# Associate one mail handler to each project
# Create one Email and having 3 mail handlers in "TO" field
# Send

h3. Expected Results
Since we have 3 mail handlers 3 issues with same summary and description should be created in 3 different projects.

h3. Actual Results
It has been tested in version 6.0.8 and the issues can be created, but in versions 6.3.x and 6.4.x, the issues being created randomly in different projects.

The following error has been found in the test instance and the customer's JIRA instance:
{code}
2015-01-28 14:28:52,060 WARN [Test1] atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-1 ServiceRunner    Testone Testone[10300]: Deleting message 'David Currie - order 1 2 3' without processing in order to avoid creating duplicate issues/comments. This message has already been partially processed, associated issue key: EMTHREE-6
{code}
fields.summary: Duplicate issues creation fails - Creating multiple issues by one Email
Inline Wiki Markup Rendering in JIRA Description Field

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41829].
  {panel}

Suggestion:

In the History entries and also the email notification, implement the additions and deletions formatting similar to the Confluence notification

e.g. Additions highlighted in Green and Deletions highlighted in red.

This will help in quickly identifying what has changed in a story without having to do a compare of the before and after state.

It would also be good if the emails displayed the actual formatting rather than the formatting marks, to improve readability.

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41827].
  {panel}

*Current Behavior*
# Run an issue search in JIRA
# Press "Save As" to save the issue filter
# Filter is automatically added to "Favorite Filters" panel

*Feature Behavior*
# Toggle 'Save Filters to Favorites' to _False_
# Run an issue search in JIRA
# Press "Save As" to save the issue filter
# Filter is *not* automatically added to "Favorite Filters" panel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41814].
  {panel}

h2. Description:

What happens currently when editing a description is that your edits are discarded if the Escape key is pressed.

There are many reasons why the Escape key can be pressed by mistake in today's browser use and varied workflows, and so users end up losing their unsaved descriptions.  

Furthermore, Jira [itself|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+Keyboard+Shortcuts?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fconfluence.atlassian.com%2Fdisplay%2FJIRA%2FUsing%2BKeyboard%2BShortcuts&application=cac] encourages the use of the Escape key to clear the focus of the current fields.

If you click away from a description edit box to lose focus, your work is saved.  However, if you use the Escape key to lose focus, your work is discarded.  This is inconsistent behavior.

The above behavior is in contrast to how editing comments behaves.  When editing comments, navigating away whether by click, escape key, or page refresh, will popup an alert for the user to confirm their action (when there are changes to the comment).  

I'm not sure why editing comments is given so much more importance than editing issue descriptions, but both edit operations should behave consistent with eachother, as it is confusing for the user to have separate behaviors depending on what you edit.

h2. What should happen:

1. Make editing issue descriptions behave the same way as when editing comments.
* Alert box will show when there is risk of losing changes.

2. As a way of allowing users to preserve current behavior with mininal disruption, provide users a way to configure the behavior of the ESC key in description boxes.  Possible (but not exaustive) list of choices:

* Escape to discard changes, no confirmation (Current behavior, should be default for existing accounts)
* Escape to discard changes, require confirmation (Can be default for new accounts)
* Escape to save changes, no confirmation (Alternatively, can be default for new accounts)
* Escape only to lose focus but leaving text area in edit mode
* Do nothing

See: my [previous comments|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-36670?focusedCommentId=692922&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-692922] for a longer rant on this topic.
fields.summary: Make ESC key behavior consistent across description and comment edit operations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41811].
  {panel}

Allow Administrators rather than System-administrator to have permission to configure the listeners in the *JIRA Toolkit Plugin* to allow re-opening of issues on comments from e-mail.

as described in this document for JIRA Server:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/HowTo%3A+Reopen+an+issue+when+a+User+comments

The listener functionality of the plugin is currently locked down to system-administrator and therefore cannot be configured on JIRA CLOUD.

Setting this to administrator or site-admin would allow this to be configured.
fields.summary: Allow Administrators Permission to configure Custom listener

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41810].
  {panel}

How to reproduce:
# Go to EAN (https://ecosystem.atlassian.net)
# Edit an issue, or create a new issue
# Look at the new formatting bar
# Select a line of text
# Click "Bold"
# Notice the text is now surrounded by asterisks
# Deselect the line of text, do something else
# Now select the entire line, including the asterisks
# Click "Bold" again
# Notice that extra asterisks have been added. I would expect the ones that are already there to be removed

It seems like the "unformat" function only works if you don't select the formatting characters. That is if I have {{\*foo\*}} and I select just {{foo}} then it will work. If I select the entire text then I end up with {{\*\*foo\*\*}}.
fields.summary: New JIRA formatting bar doesn't "unformat"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41806].
  {panel}

JIRA allows [priority|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+Priority+Field+Values] and [issue type|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+Issue+Type+Field+Values] icons to be customised, but they are stored by default on the <JIRA_INSTALL> folder structure (e.g. usually on {{<jira-application-dir>/images/icons}}).
Our current documentation does not include steps to migrate these files:
- [Upgrading JIRA Manually|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA+Manually]
- [Upgrading JIRA with a Fallback Method|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA+with+a+Fallback+Method]
- [Migrating JIRA to Another Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+JIRA+to+Another+Server#MigratingJIRAtoAnotherServer-configuringnewjiraasold]

We should update our documentation to cover such scenario.
fields.summary: The JIRA upgrade documentation should cover the migration of custom icons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41798].
  {panel}

It would be nice to have the ability to set a notification to send to a group but then Exclude (or Except) certain users or possibly even other groups.
For example:
Dev group: User1, User2, User3, User4, User5, User6, User7
Mgmt group: User6, User7
Notify Dev group except for Mgmt group
Notify Dev group except for User6

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41797].
  {panel}

When connecting to different JIRA or Confluence servers you start haivng duplicate gadgets from different instances.

At this moment is quite hard to distinguish one from another and a huge number of users are reporting inssues just because they do not see the different URL.

This is happening due to the current bad design of how gadget are listed.
You need to perform some changes in the UI that would make it clear what is the data-source.

I would advise on listing the data source as a category in the left menu, it would much easier for people to pick the right gadget this way.
fields.summary: gadget source is not clear and confuses users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41791].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# On JIRA have Activity Stream on your dashboard
# Log work on some issue with a description

*Expected Results:*
# The Activity Stream would show up this activity with the description of the entry. E.g.:
{noformat}Elisa Diel [Administrator] updated 2 fields of HHH-2 - Testing
Changed the Remaining Estimate to '0 minutes'
Description testing LogWork entry on AS.{noformat}

*Actual Results:*
# The Activity Stream doesn't show any description of the activity. 
E.g.:
{noformat}Elisa Diel [Administrator] updated 2 fields of HHH-2 - Testing
Changed the Remaining Estimate to '0 minutes'
Logged '1 hour'{noformat}

*Notes:*
According to https://design.atlassian.com/2.0/product/patterns/activity-stream the add-on should detail the information as shown in the "Complex Items" entries.
fields.summary: Activity Stream won't show comment on LogWork

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41789].
  {panel}

In the old version of JIRA (5.x), a *Two Dimensional Filter Statistics* gadget can display more information without having to scroll as the columns are narrower. In JIRA 6, the columns became wider and users will have to scroll right to view. It would be better that the columns remain as narrow as possible so as much information can be displayed.

For example, if you have a workflow with the following statuses
* Open
* In Progress
* Reopened
* Resolved
* Closed
* Analysing
* Escalated

In JIRA 5.x, you can see information from Open until Escalated without having to scroll right. In JIRA 6.x, you can only see information up to Closed. For Analysing and Escalated, users must scroll right. This can be pretty inconvenient.
fields.summary: Columns for Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget to be Narrower

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41787].
  {panel}

***Summary***
The screenshot and steps of [*Creating an issue type*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+Issue+Type+Field+Values#DefiningIssueTypeFieldValues-Creatinganissuetype] need to be updated.

We have updated the process of uploading custom issue type icon. In the previous version, customers can provide icon URL to upload their custom issue type icon. We have updated the issue type icon configuration that customer can upload the custom icon via their local device (Computer). Please refer to this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+Issue+Type+Field+Values#DefiningIssueTypeFieldValues-Creatinganissuetype].

***Steps to reproduce***
# Sign in to JIRA.
# Click on *Cog* icon.
# Select *Issues*.
# Click on *Issue Types* on the left navigation bar.
# Click *Add Issue Type*.
# You will find this page !Add_Issue_Type_Box.png|thumbnail!
# The documentation still showing with the URL icon field. Please refer to this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+Issue+Type+Field+Values#DefiningIssueTypeFieldValues-Creatinganissuetype].
# This also happened to JIRA Cloud application, Please refer to this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Defining+Issue+Type+Field+Values#DefiningIssueTypeFieldValues-Creatinganissuetype].
fields.summary: Creating an issue type documentation needs some update

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41775].
  {panel}

We are soon phasing out Jelly in JIRA 6.4 but the documentation for 6.4 does not reflect this. Example : 
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Jelly+Tags
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Jelly+Escalation
(i) There could be other docs as well.

In fact these docs should not exist for 6.4 since Jelly is completely getting removed in JIRA 6.4. We should add a warning in all the other versions of JIRA.

Currently, there is no warning to inform the customers about this change.
fields.summary: JIRA Jelly documentation needs to be updated

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41771].
  {panel}

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Streamlining+your+development+with+JIRA

In this document, this is all that is said about GitHub:

"GitHub
You can configure the DVCS Connector plugin in JIRA in order to see branch, commits and pull request information in the Development panel of a JIRA issue."

It states that the connector can see a branch. However, it should be made more clear that the DVCS Connector for GitHub does not have the ability create branches. By omission, it essentially says this, but the document should be explicit. The ability to create branches exists within Atlassian products only, and not with a connection to GitHub.
fields.summary: Add that we don't allow creating branches with GitHub to our Docs
"inltokxyzkdtnhgnsbdfinltok0inltokxyzkdtnhgnsbdfinltok" appears to be a mysterious macro that duplicates content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41769].
  {panel}

As a project administrator using an OnDemand\Cloud JIRA instance, I would like to be able to add pre-scripted comments to tickets as part of a workflow transition so that I don't need to prompt my users for the same notes over and over.

I feel like this may have been asked already, but I can't find the ticket. What I'm looking for is the ability to pre-define a comment as a post-function and then have this comment added to the ticket as it passes through the transition. I realize this is possible using scripts, but as an OnDemand user those options aren't open to me, and this _appears_ to be a pretty simple ask. It would be a bonus to be able to put in short codes with current_user, date\time, etc.

My use-case:
We have a "QA" status during which our QA people do their thing, and either pass the ticket along or send it back to devs for more work. We prompt them for a comment either way, but if they're passing it the comment is almost always the same ("Passed QA").
fields.summary: Add Pre-Defined Comment to Ticket During Transition for OD\Cloud Instances
Who support NAMO
Allow dashboards to be managed by project admins
decimal point should be configurable independent of language
Space Administrators can not see group members

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41755].
  {panel}

We use JIRA to run our business due to it's flexibility and range of plugins.
We use Tempo to log time for billing, and for traffic management for our project and retainer jobs across two physical offices 100's of kilometers apart.

The issue with UTC v local time is causing us headaches from compliance overheads as people have to manually go back and reenter timesheet entries.

A switchable option for UTC/local is a vital feature for us.

We are also looking at Project Online as a PMO/tracking system - and this would exacerbate our issues.
fields.summary: Upvoting JRA-35503
Broken "Updated the issue" notification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41752].
  {panel}

My team uses GitHub with Markdown for text effects

One of the MAJOR reasons the team will not switch to JIRA for inputting their issues is that JIRA text effects do not support CHECK BOXES:


- [ ] creates a check box
- [x] creates a checked box


PLEASE ADD THESE TO MAKE YOUR USERS LIVES WONDERFUL

:)
fields.summary: [text fields] text effects - NEED checkbox!!!
